abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Multi-Sectoral Water and
            Electricity Infrastructure Project for Burundi were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was substantial, Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: redressing dysfunctional sectors in
            post-conflict countries depends on well-defined incremental
            reforms, field-based implementation support, and continuous
            policy dialogue. The performance contract with clearly
            specified expectations was a useful tool to introduce a
            culture of performance and strengthening of institutional
            overlay for the public utility company. A multi-sector
            project can succeed if it addresses underlying cross-cutting
            institutional issues.
